Sentencas: Syngas cogeneration in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells with Ni-yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) anodes was studied with temperature varying from 700 to 900 degrees C. A phenomenon of electrochemical promotion of bulk lattice-oxygen extraction from the YSZ electrolyte was observed.
Titulo: Temperature effect on electrochemical promotion of syngas cogeneration in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: With increasing temperature, this promotion effect increases while both the rate enhancement ratios of CO and CO2 formations decrease.
Titulo: Temperature effect on electrochemical promotion of syngas cogeneration in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The activation energy of CO and CO2 formation under close circuit is lower than that under open circuit.
Titulo: Temperature effect on electrochemical promotion of syngas cogeneration in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The activation energy for the lattice-oxygen extraction from the YSZ bulk is higher than that for the oxygen transport through the YSZ bulk.
Titulo: Temperature effect on electrochemical promotion of syngas cogeneration in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The process of lattice-oxygen extraction from YSZ is rate determining in direct-methane oxidation under the condition of either close circuit or open circuit.
Titulo: Temperature effect on electrochemical promotion of syngas cogeneration in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The dependence of CO fort-nation rate on the oxygen supply rate is stronger than that of CO2 formation rate.
Titulo: Temperature effect on electrochemical promotion of syngas cogeneration in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Electrochemical promotion of bulk lattice-oxygen extraction enhances syngas cogeneration.
Titulo: Temperature effect on electrochemical promotion of syngas cogeneration in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells
Temperature effect on electrochemical promotion of syngas cogeneration in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells
Temperature effect on electrochemical promotion of syngas cogeneration in direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells
